page.title: 09Local History
page.content: The Church of St John the Baptist stands on a hill overlooking the castle and the old village. It is a typical small country church mostly of Norman architecture, but possibly some small remains of an Anglo-Saxon wall and a little post Norman work. The tower was built in the 14th C. It is still open as a church with services twice a month, but rather a sparse congregation. It is combined with the small Bolton Chapel 3 miles to the north and shares a Vicar with the Parish of Whittingham 4 miles to the west. The ruins of the castle and the Solar tower have been made safe, part of the old walls have been rebuilt and in 1986 it will be open to the public.
